heading: If the other parent wants you to go to mediation
lede: You may have been contacted by a mediator or the other parent may have asked you to try mediation. It’s important to understand what mediation is and how it could help your situation.
lede_additional: The other parent may have approached a professional mediator because they want help to reach a decision about arrangements for your children. Or you may have been invited to a ‘Mediation Information and Assessment Meeting’ or ‘MIAM’, which is a legal requirement before the other parent can apply to court.
summary_lede_additional: The other parent may have approached a professional mediator because they want help to reach a decision about arrangements for your children. Or you may have been invited to a ‘Mediation Information and Assessment Meeting’ or ‘MIAM’, which is a legal requirement before the other parent can apply to court.
